channel.title: RealGM Basketball Wiretap
channel.description: Basketball News, Rumors, Scores, Stats, Analysis, Depth Charts, Forums

item.title: Steven Adams, Grizzlies Sign Two-Year, $25.2M Extension
item.description:
Steven Adams and the Memphis Grizzlies have agreed to a two-year, $25.2 million contract extension.

Adams is now signed with the Grizzlies for three more seasons at $43.1 million.

Adams averaged 6.9 points and 10 rebounds last season for the Grizzlies.

item.title: Larry Nance Jr. Agrees To Two-Year, $21.6M Extension With Pelicans
item.description:
Larry Nance Jr. signed a two-year, $21.6 million extension with the New Orleans Pelicans, reported Adrian Wojnarowski of ESPN.

Nance, who was traded to the Pelicans last season, averaged 7.3 points and 4.3 rebounds in nine games.

item.title: Warriors In Talks With Ty Jerome For Training Camp Deal, Unlikely To Fill 15th Roster Spot
item.description:
The Golden State Warriors and Ty Jerome are working on a training camp deal after Jerome clears waivers on Monday, sources told Anthony Slater and Shams Charania of The Athletic.

Jerome was most recently waived by the Rockets following a trade from the Thunder.

The Warriors are still finalizing their plans for two-way deals and are also unlikely to fill their 15th roster spot for tax savings.

item.title: Thunder Sign Sacha Killeya-Jones
item.description:
The Oklahoma City Thunder announced the signing of Sacha Killeya-Jones on Sunday.

The 24-year-old most recently played for Hapoel Gilboa Galil last season.

The team also waived Sterling Brown.

item.title: Luke Kornet To Miss 1-2 Weeks With Sprained Ankle
item.description:
Luke Kornet is expected to miss 1-2 weeks for the Boston Celtics after spraining his ankle in practice on Thursday.

The Celtics recently signed Blake Griffin, who is likely to be the team's backup center to open the season.

item.title: Thunder Waive Sterling Brown
item.description:
The Oklahoma City Thunder have waived Sterling Brown.

Brown, who appeared in 49 games for the Mavs last season, was most recently involved in a multi-player trade from the Rockets.

item.title: 'Influential' Members Of Knicks Organization Expect Team To Take Step Forward This Season
item.description:
"Influential" people within the New York Knicks have set an expectation that the team take a step forward this season, sources told Ian Begley of SNY.

The Knicks finished with a 37-45 record last year.

Tom Thibodeau said earlier this week that he doesn't feel any pressure heading into his third season with the team.

"I've never felt pressure, ever. See, when you put everything you have into your job, that's all you can do. So I've never felt pressure. Others can say this, that; that ain't happening here. Just get ready (to play)," said Thibodeau.

Team president Leon Rose was given the choice to part ways with Thibodeau heading into last All-Star break but decided to stick by the coach.

Begley adds that members within the Knicks organization are looking to see a "tangible improvement" this upcoming season.

item.title: Otto Porter Jr. Out 'A Little Bit' Due To Hamstring
item.description:
Otto Porter Jr. will be out "a little bit" after tweaking his hamstring in training camp, according to Nick Nurse.

Porter signed a two-year, $12.3 million deal with the Raptors this offseason.

item.title: Marcus Smart Signs Multi-Year Endorsement Extension With Puma
item.description:
Marcus Smart has signed a multi-year endorsement extension with Puma, reported Nick DePaula of ESPN.

The endorsement covers both footwear and apparel.

Smart averaged 12.1 points and 5.9 assists in 71 games last season.

item.title: Gordon Hayward Misses Preseason Game Due To Knee Contusion
item.description:
Gordon Hayward is set to miss the Charlotte Hornets' preseason game against the Boston Celtics due to a knee contusion.

Steve Clifford said that Hayward was limited after banging his knee in practice.

Hayward averaged 15.9 points and 4.6 rebounds in 49 games last season.

item.title: NBA Partners With Microsoft To Rebuild Mobile App, League Pass
item.description:
The NBA partnered with Microsoft to both rebuild its mobile app and improve NBA League Pass ahead of the upcoming season.

The NBA decreased the price for League Pass down to $14.99 for a single device and $19.99 for multiple devices.

League Pass will also feature Microsoft's artificial intelligence to customize stats for betting and fantasy leagues.

"That's going to make watching live games a completely new experience," said Chris Benyarko, the NBA's executive vice president of direct-to-consumer.

The mobile app will feature enhancements to mimic Instagram stories, a series around the Warriors, and a "game vault" with classic NBA games.

item.title: Blazers End Jersey Sponsorship With StormX
item.description:
The Portland Trail Blazers ended their jersey sponsorship with crypto startup StormX ahead of the upcoming season.

The deal, which was signed starting in the 2021-22 season, was originally contracted for five years.

"As we tip-off the 2022-23 season, we will launch a search to identify a new jersey patch partner as we've ended our current relationship with StormX. We'll share additional information in the near future on this exciting new opportunity," the Blazers released in a statement.

StormX was originally founded in 2015 and allowed users to earn crypto rewards through shopping at stores.

item.title: Kawhi Leonard, John Wall Set To Return On Monday
item.description:
Kawhi Leonard and John Wall are set to make their return to the basketball court on Monday, according to Ty Lue.

Leonard missed all of last season while recovering from a partially torn ACL.

Wall sat out last season after reaching a mutual decision with the Rockets to not play.

item.title: Kendrick Nunn, Damian Jones In Lakers' Starting Lineup For Training Camp
item.description:
Kendrick Nunn and Damian Jones have featured as part of Darvin Ham's preferred starting lineup during training camp.

Nunn and Jones join LeBron James, Anthony Davis, and Russell Westbrook as starters.

Ham said that Nunn, who missed all of last season, will play a big role for the team this upcoming year.

"It's almost like he's a new player, he's a free agent for us. So, I told him he's going to be a big part of what I'm trying to do and he's embraced it and you can tell by his play thus far," said Ham of Nunn.

Ham then complimented Jones' athleticism and defense.

"Damian is just a really young, athletic big. He runs like a deer. He can jump to the ceiling. Really defensive-minded. Tries to protect the rim. Sets good screens. Rolls hard. Creating a constant threat at the rim," said Ham.

item.title: Celtics Waive Denzel Valentine To Make Room For Blake Griffin
item.description:
The Boston Celtics are waiving Denzel Valentine, sources told Shams Charania and Jared Weiss of The Athletic.

Valentine was waived to make room for Blake Griffin, who signed with the team on Friday.

item.title: Rockets Convert Bruno Fernando To Two-Way Contract
item.description:
The Houston Rockets will convert Bruno Fernando to a Two-Way contract.

Fernando was originally signed to an Exhibit 10 deal.

item.title: Celtics Won't Stand In Way Of Ime Udoka Becoming Candidate For Another Team
item.description:
The Boston Celtics will not stand in the way of Ime Udoka becoming a coaching candidate with another team, sources tell ESPN.

Rival teams are trying to gather a preliminary understanding of the full explanation for Udoka's season long suspension in preparing for evaluating him for future coaching employment.

Udoka had an improper workplace relationship with a woman, who he reportedly used crude language with prior to them becoming intimate.

The Celtics promoted Joe Mazzulla to interim coach for the upcoming season.

item.title: Report: Ime Udoka Used Crude Language With Subordinate Prior To Start Of Relationship
item.description:
According to the findings of an independent law firm, Ime Udoka used crude language in his dialogue with a female subordinate prior to the start of an improper workplace relationship, which was an element that factored into his one-year suspension.

The verbiage was especially concerning coming from a workplace superior, according to the findings.

This reportedly contributes to a difficult pathway back to his reinstatement as head coach of the Boston Celtics in 2023.

The power dynamic associated with a superior's improper relationship with a staff member was the primary finding and policy violation cited in the law firm's report, which was commissioned by the Celtics and completed early last week.

item.title: Miles Bridges Has Domestic Violence Hearing Delayed For 4th Time
item.description:
A hearing for the domestic violence case against Miles Bridges was delayed this week for the fourth time and moved to October 7th.

The scheduled hearing is to determine whether there is enough evidence to take Bridges to trial.

Bridges was arrested on June 29th in Los Angeles and charged with beating his girlfriend in front of their two children. Police described the incident as "Intimate Partner Violence with Injury."

Bridges pled not guilty to three felony charges: injuring a child's parent; and two counts of child abuse under circumstances or conditions likely to cause great bodily injury or death. Bridges faces up to almost 12 years in prison if convicted of all three.

Bridges' accuser posted photos on social media of her injuries.

Bridges remains a restricted free agent after the Charlotte Hornets tendered him a $7.9 million qualifying offer.

Regardless of the legal process, Bridges is expected to receive a substantial NBA suspension.

item.title: Kevin Durant: Nets Understood I Was Upset
item.description:
Kevin Durant expounded on his trade request from the Brooklyn Nets and his ultimate decision to remain with the franchise.

"I was upset and as a family, they understood that I was upset," said Durant via Brian Lewis of the New York Post. "And some of the stuff they agree with. And so we talked about and it was over a couple of months, couple of weeks...we worked it out from there, and I'm here now."

As much as Durant wanted out, he saw the Nets as continuing to be a good option.

"I felt like we had a good team," said Durant via Nick Friedell of ESPN. "I felt like this is the place I said I wanted to be. We started to set something up in the future to be a solid team. So to be honest I thought this was still a great option, too."

In Durant's comments to the media, he also alluded to how there were a lot of inaccuracies with the reporting.

item.title: RealGM Radio: Sam Vecenie On The 2023 NBA Draft (Sep 2022)
item.description:
Host Danny Leroux (@DannyLeroux) and draft expert Sam Vecenie of The Athletic and the Game Theory podcast (@Sam_Vecenie) go in-depth on the 2023 NBA Draft class.

They discuss Victor Wembanyama's place among elite prospects over the years, how Scoot Henderson can supplant him as the #1 pick, other key players/teams to watch this season and much more.

Subscribe to RealGM Radio on Apple Podcasts or via the RSS feed.

item.title: Bojan Bogdanovic Seeking Contract Extension
item.description:
Bojan Bogdanovic has been seeking a contract extension, sources tell Marc Stein, which is believed to have cooled his trade market when the Utah Jazz looked to move him. Some teams were dissuaded from more strongly pursuing Bogdanovic.

The Detroit Pistons acquired Bogdanovic with what was a less than expected offer.

Bogdanovic is on a $19.3 million expiring contract.

The Pistons could flip Bogdanovic before the trade deadline, but they want to evaluate what they first in case they remain in play-in contention.

item.title: Blake Griffin, Celtics Agree To Fully Guaranteed One-Year Deal
item.description:
Blake Griffin has agreed a one-year, fully guaranteed deal with the Boston Celtics.

Griffin spent the past season and a half with the Brooklyn Nets.

Griffin will give Boston depth in the frontcourt following the injuries to Robert Williams III and Danilo Gallinari.

The Celtics now have 11 fully guaranteed contracts on their roster, though that number does not include Al Horford's mostly guaranteed deal.

Griffin averaged 6.4 points and 4.1 rebounds across 56 games (24 starts) this past season for the Nets.

item.title: Warriors Keep Klay Thompson Out Of Both Preseason Games In Japan
item.description:
The Golden State Warriors will not play Klay Thompson in either of their two preseason games in Japan.

The Warriors held just three practices in San Francisco before their flight to Japan last Wednesday.

"Just feel more comfortable giving him a little more of a ramp up," Steve Kerr said ahead of the Warriors' 96-87 win over the Washington Wizards on Friday. "He's just not quite ready to play at this point just based on where, you know, we're so early in camp. We just want to be safe and make sure he gets a good ramp up before he plays in games."

Thompson was under a strict restriction last season as he worked his way back from a torn ACL and Achilles.

"Just coming off the two years with the injuries, this is really unique to play a game after 3½ practices so we're just being cautious and trying to do the smart thing," Kerr said.

item.title: Nets Sign Kaiser Gates To Camp Contract
item.description:
The Brooklyn Nets have signed Kaiser Gates to a training camp deal. Brooklyn's roster is back to the offseason maximum of 20 players.

Gates spent the first three seasons of his professional career in the G League. He played for the Windy City Bulls, Maine Celtics and Long Island Nets. In 98 career G League games, Gates has averaged 12.1 points and 6.6 rebounds.

Gates is likely to play for Long Island this season, as an Affiliate Player.

Last season, Gates played in Israel for Hapoel Jerusalem. In 22 games, the 6-foot-7 forward averaged 4.5 points and 4.1 rebounds.

item.title: Vincent Iwuchukwu Suffered Cardiac Arrest Over Summer, Currently 'Feeling Great'
item.description:
USC freshman center Vincent Iwuchukwu said that he suffered cardiac arrest during a workout this summer.

The incident took place on July 1, leading to his hospitalization.

"This past summer I had a sudden cardiac arrest during a workout ... currently, I am adhering to the standard protocol designed to ensure my health and safety. I'm feeling great and my recovery and rehabilitation remain positive," Iwuchukwu told CBS Sports.

Iwuchukwu was ranked No. 32 in the ESPN 100 for the 2022 class.

item.title: Cam Johnson To Start At Power Forward For Suns, Monty Williams Confirms
item.description:
Monty Williams said that Cam Johnson will start at power forward for the Phoenix Suns this season.

Johnson averaged 12.5 points and 4.1 rebounds in 26 minutes last year.

Johnson's increased role comes at the expense of Jae Crowder, who is drawing trade interest from several teams. The Suns told Crowder that he would likely lose his starting spot prior to training camp.

Williams added that he hopes Johnson and Mikal Bridges will take a larger role in facilitating the offense this season.

"The hope is he and Mikal can help out with offensive initiation. Those guys have the ability to facilitate and I just haven't given them the chance. And we've talked about being comfortable with uncomfortable change. There's going to be times where it doesn't look great but I think that's where they're going to grow," said Williams.

item.title: Rockets To Waive Ty Jerome
item.description:
The Houston Rockets are set to waive Ty Jerome, according to Kelly Iko of The Athletic.

The Rockets acquired Jerome as part of a multi-player deal with the Thunder.

item.title: Get Your Latest NBA News From RealGM's Basketball Wiretap
item.description: Get all the latest news and happenings from around the NBA with RealGM's Basketball Wiretap.
